answers.answer: Have you talked to your doc about all the swelling. Also make sure your staying away from salt.

Sounds like you're doing what you can. I have taken to wearing flip flops because that's what fits. Make sure your doctor is aware of your swelling and is checking your blood pressure and looking for protein in your urine.

I cant even get flip flops on :( I wore my dad's shoes the other day, and he's a tall guy. I talked to my ob about it on tues and they were a little concerned because I gained 10 lbs in a single week, and my bp was higher then they wanted. I have a low salt diet anyway because my grampa needs it and we cook for him.Just wish I could get my shoes on. Any pair of shoes!

I get some swelling at 34wks 4d. What works best for me is going for a light walk then getting my feet up above my heart and drinking lots of water.It sounds like your Doctor may be concerned about pre-eclampsia. The retention, rapid weight gain and high blood pressure are symptoms. Did they check your urine for protein? Are you having any issues with headaches or your vision? When is your next check up?I don't want to freak you out, but my Doc is concerned because my BP was a little high this week. He told me if I get a headache that won't go away after I take a Tylenol that I need to call him right away. He also said if I have spotty or blurred vision I need to call.Good luck & best wishes!

My feet would take a while to go down. I had to keep them elevated and stay off them a while. If I walked any or even crossed my feet, they would swell! I'm a 8.5 but always wore a lose 9 and my size 9 flats are tight and uncomfortable!
Weird that I didn't have much swelling until about 36weeks. I'm 38wks and a couple days and I haven't had any swelling anymore.
Is seeing spots in your vision a sign of preeclampsia? I get that a lot lately. They said that there wasnt any protein in my urine the last time, but i do have an appt on tues

Seeing spots can be a symptom of pre-eclampsia. Maybe you should call your doctor to let him know about the vision and find out if he wants to see you sooner. I don't want you to worry unnecessarily, but I would rather you and the baby be safe.I have orders from my doctor to call immediately if there are any changes with my vision at all simply because my BP was a little high for me on Friday. (personally I think it was from my tired/cranky 3 year old coupled with having to drive 90 miles in the one day).I hope it's nothing serious and all just coincidental.

question: Hey everyone! I'm at the 32w mark and having a bit of a problem with swelling in my legs, feet, ankles, and hands. I have been using epsom salts daily, compression socks, putting my feet up and drinking lots of water. And I still cant get the swelling to go down. I also got a support belt that is supposed to help, and it feels good, but I cant fit in any shoes at all. I am at a loss on what to do and was hoping someone could give me a suggestion that I havent tried yet.Any advice is greatly appreciated!!!! :)
title: any tips for reducing swelling?
